intro: Goniothalamus elmeri var. gitingensis, commonly known as the Gitingen garambullo, is a tropical climbing plant native to the Philippines. It belongs to the family Annonaceae and is characterized by its compound leaves and fragrant flowers. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers that develop into fleshy, berry-like fruits. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in lowland rainforests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
